# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load in 

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the "../input/" directory.
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# Any results you write to the current directory are saved as output.

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter('ignore')
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib as p
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline

import plotly.graph_objs as gobj
from plotly.offline import download_plotlyjs,init_notebook_mode,plot,iplot
init_notebook_mode(connected=True)

import plotly.express as px       
import plotly.offline as py       
import plotly.graph_objects as go 
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots

# Added secondary axis
fig = go.Figure()
fig = make_subplots(specs=[[{"secondary_y": True}]])
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=measures_gr5['entry_date'], y=measures_gr5['sum'], name='Sum of measures implemented', marker_color='rgb(60, 83, 109)'), secondary_y=True)
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=status_df_gr3['reported_date'],y=status_df_gr3['sum_total_deaths'],name='Total Deaths by Reported Date',marker_color='rgb(70, 118, 255)'))

fig.update_layout(title='Measures Implemented and Total Deaths',xaxis_tickfont_size=14,
                  yaxis=dict(title='Sum',titlefont_size=16,tickfont_size=14,),
    legend=dict(x=0,y=1.0,bgcolor='rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)',bordercolor='rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)'),
    barmode='group',bargap=0.15, bargroupgap=0.1)
fig.show()

                  yaxis=dict(title='Sum',titlefont_size=16,tickfont_size=14,),

source.37608b30:

ax = sns.lineplot(x="reported_date", y="sum_total_deaths", data=status_china, c = 'red', linewidth = 3)

plt.ylabel("sum_total_deaths", size=14)
plt.tick_params(axis='x', rotation = 90,  labelsize = 12)
plt.tick_params(axis='y', labelsize = 12) 
plt.title('China - Total Deaths', size = 14)
plt.show()

* Belgium, similar to Germany, has seen rise in the count of Total Deaths and fluctuating rise in New Total Deaths with the latest being a dip.
* We do not have data of measures implmeneted post 03-27
source.5a88f1d8:
* Though we see a rising trend the counts are not relatively high for Armenia.
* We see a lot of closure and border/travel restriction measures being implemented. Could these have helped?
source.b23b03db: * Italy has experienced a continued rise in counts of Total Deaths as well as New Total Deaths despite the implementation of different measures.
source.f36c7c89:
* Another example of rising trend of Total Deaths but counts being relatively on the lesser side. Even the New Total Death counts do not show an alarming trend, excluding the spike on 04-05.
* We see a lot of measure being implemented frequently by Australia.
source.8fd82995: #### Not completely sure if these are the datasets that would suffice or are appropriate, but based on what I found, did some layman analysis and noted my findings. In my quest to cover as much countries as possible you will find the same set of codes repeated and the obvious feeling of a repeat teleacast; but I couldn't help it. I was trying to find some trend between the measures and death counts. I think I did find a few but on an overall not sure if I could make any sense out of it.
source.570e6614:
* Iran too has experienced constant rise in the number of Total Deaths and we only have data for two dates for the measures implemented.
* Post 03-17 the New Total Death count has been withing the 100-150 range after the spike on 03-16.
source.685c58e5:
* From 03-23 onwards France started to see the rise in count of Total Deaths and New Total Deaths and something happened in April where it rocketed.
* Post 03-23 we do not see any Full Lockdown or similar measures being implemented.
source.8a208ec8:
* We can see that both the Total Deaths and New Total Death counts were relatively lower till towards the end of March, post which it increased.
* We can also see that there were several measures implemented till 03-24 which could have contributed, while post 03-24 we do not see significant measures being implemented. Could this be one of the reasons contributing to the rise of counts post 03-26?
source.5ce9a44a: ## 4. Plots of Measures Implemented vs Total and New Total Deaths [Back to Table of Contents](#0.1)
source.23026b6d:
* Steady rise in Total Death counts with fluctuating occurrences for New Total Deaths in the range of 0-8.
* We do not have data post 03-31 of measure implemented.
source.11c8f8b6:
* Germany too has experienced constant rise in the counts of deaths.
* The latest New Total Death count does show a dip

source.227a0c55:
* Rise in Total Deaths, similar to Switzerland
* Steady rise in New Total Deaths with a spike and dip in April

source.c2263e4d:
* Brazil has seen rise in the counts of Total Deaths and New Total Deaths.
* We do not have data post 03-29 and anything related to Lockdown

source.0d7a0ba5: ## 3.5 New Total Deaths by Reported_Date [Back to Table of Contents](#0.1)
source.4a394b59: * We can observe a lot of measures being implemented after the second week of March as compared to the following weeks as compared to the rise in Total and New Total Death counts
source.7e080ff1: * Spain, similar to Italy, has experienced a continued rise in counts of Total Deaths as well as New Total Deaths despite the implementation of different measures.
source.7bd48435:
* Switzerland has also observed gradual rise in the count of Total Deaths and fluctuation the New Total Deaths between 0-60
* Spikes observed in April
source.2c3a79f8:
* Post 03-21 USA has seen rise in the counts of Total Deaths and New Total Deaths which rocketed in April and looks like the measures implemented did not create the impact desired.
* We also do not have data for the measure implemented post 03-27.
source.16c2690e: ## 2.3 Grouping by Entry Date, Category [Back to Table of Contents](#0.1)
source.e7b5b4c7:
* Occurrences of death observed in April.
* There was an extensive measures implementation done on 03-20. Could that have helped Bahamas?
source.828b2319:
* Portugal has seen a steady rise in Total Death count. We don't see a rocketing spike in April.
* For New Total Death, excluding the spike of 04-05, the count appeared to be contained between 20-25 post 03-29. Could the Strengthening the public health system along with other measures implemented post 03-29 might have helped?
source.83ef08ff: ## 10. Japan, Azerbaijan, Bahamas, Bahrain, Bangladesh [Back to Table of Contents](#0.1)
source.c6854614: ## 2.4 Grouping by Entry Date, Category, Measure [Back to Table of Contents](#0.1)
source.b37b8420:
* After 03-14, Albania has been implementing different measures from time to time and we do not see an alarming trend for New Total Deaths
* We do have to consider the several Movement restrictions being implemented
* Another observation is post 03-24 Total Deaths have constantly risen despite the maximum occurrences of measures being implemented post 03-14
source.9589ac62:
* This is another scenario of several Movement restrictions implementation required.
* Although Total Death count rises gradually, it isn't drastic under 04-03. Something happened on 04-03 where the New Total Death count also rocketed and Military Deployment was required.
* Could it be due to rise of cases in municipality of Shkodër or due to 04-03 being the initial end of Lockdown.
source.52a6b0e9:
* The Total Death counts show a steady rise
* The New Totla Death counts fluctuate between 0-20 with several dips

source.fc1829e5:
* Post 03-23 Netherlands has seen constant rise in the count of Total Deaths, while the New Total Deaths do show fluctuating behavior (though on the higher side) with the latest showing a dipping trend.
* We also do not have any data of measures being implemented consistently post 03-23 nor anything related to proper Lockdown.
source.048f165d: ## 3.3 New Total Deaths by Country/Territory, Reported_Date [Back to Table of Contents](#0.1)
source.7764b12b:
* The rise in number of Total Deaths in China decreased and flattened towards the second week of March compared to the previous weeks, right about when different measures were implementation on and post 03-15. 
* It also appears w.r.t. the rate of rise of Total Deaths, the implementation of different measures on 03-21 could have helped as we also see the decrease and sustenance in the number of New Total Deaths.
* Although not sure what measures were implemented before 03-15, we do see a drastic drop in New Total Deaths post 02-26.
* Also do not see much measures related to Immigration and Travel being implemented.

source.d80f50ff: ## 3. Analyzing Deaths [Back to Table of Contents](#0.1)
source.9034be6f:
* Post 03-21 UK, similar to US, has seen rise in the counts of Total Deaths and New Total Deaths which rocketed in April.
* We also do not have data for the measure implemented post 03-24, and even if anything was implemented, based on the rise in count it didn't seem to have worked as desired.
source.1f7195fb:
* Steady rise in Total Deaths
* Spiking occurences in New Total Deaths

source.52c11233:
* The count in Total Death has gradually increased for Korea.
* New Total Deaths exhibit fluctuating trend between 0-10 with the latest being a dip.
* We do not have data post 03-23 for measures being implemented.
source.01dbdff7:
* Although we do not have any data of measures implemented post 03-20, and the Total Death trend is on the rise, the counts are relatively on the lesser side.
* Even the New Total Death count hasn't crossed 1 on any day.
source.15983f70:
* Another example of though the there is a rising trend for Total Deaths, the count is on the lesser side.
* Not much data on the measures implemented.
source.982adca3: # How is the implementation of existing strategies affecting the rates of COVID-19 infection?
source.922d3da9:
* Angola started implementing measures back in Jan with two effective actions of awareness campaigns and strengthening the public health system.
* They have constantly strengthened the public health system and post 04-03 which recorded the first death count, they have become more agressive with implemention of measures.
source.6d7217e1:
* After 03-14 is when we observe occurrences under Total Deaths and New Total Deaths, although the frequencies are very less compared to other countries with massive counts 
* The measures taken udner each category could have contributed toward mitigating any drastic rise in death counts
